optimal_care.description: Use proper cookware size matched to burner size, avoid using pans larger than burner
Keep burner ports clean and unobstructed for proper flame
Clean griddle after each use and season with light coat of cooking oil
Clean control panel immediately after spills to prevent damage
Run appropriate cleaning cycles regularly based on usage
Keep oven racks properly maintained using vegetable oil on edges if stiff
Clean glass door carefully and avoid harsh abrasives that could scratch

support.description: Visit GEAppliances.com/service to schedule service online
Call 800.432.2737 for direct phone support during business hours
Register product at GEAppliances.com/register for enhanced support

safety.description: Install and verify anti-tip bracket is properly secured to prevent tipping
Never leave surface burners unattended while cooking - fire hazard
Keep flammable materials, aerosols and vapors away from appliance
Don't cover oven bottom or racks with foil - blocks airflow and causes hazard

cleaning.description: Use mild soap and water or vinegar solution for exterior cleaning
Use hot soapy water for burner parts, grates can go in dishwasher
Steam clean for light soils, self-clean cycle for heavy soils
For stainless steel surfaces, use specific stainless cleaners and wipe in grain direction

maintenance.description: Annual inspection by qualified service technician recommended
Run cleaning cycles based on usage frequency and soil level
Check and clean burner ports monthly to prevent clogs
